subject: Languages
title: Shakespeare Invents 1,700 Words
description: A fast breakdown of Shakespeare Invents 1,700 Words for builders.

hook.text: If a word didn't exist, Shakespeare made one up. 'Lonely,' 'generous,' 'assassination' â€” all his.

buildup.text: During the English Renaissance, writers were hungry for new vocabulary.

discovery.text: Shakespeare invented or first recorded over 1,700 English words and countless phrases.

twist.text: Many of his coinages failed. 'Abrook' and 'bepaint' vanished without a trace.

climax.text: 'Break the ice,' 'wild goose chase,' 'heart of gold' â€” we quote him daily.

punchline.text: Shakespeare didn't just write plays. He expanded the entire language.
